modules.title: Traffic Vision
modules.description: Training to recognize traffic situations early and react correctly. Focus on sensorimotor skills and methods for successful driver training.

modules.title: Traffic Environment
modules.description: Adapting speed to the current situation. Using 360-degree videos from Zug to teach appropriate driving behavior. Assessing pedestrians, roads, and visibility conditions.

modules.title: Traffic Dynamics
modules.description: Basic rules of driving physics. Covering electronic assistance systems and vehicle maintenance (using Tesla and combustion engines as examples).

modules.title: Traffic Tactics
modules.description: Strategies for safe driving. Examining the influence of fatigue, distraction, drugs, and medication. Risk prevention is the priority.

faq.question: When should I attend the traffic theory course?
faq.answer: Immediately after passing the theory exam. The VKU is valid indefinitely and allows you to register for the practical driving test (if no annual deadline applies).

faq.question: What is traffic theory instruction?
faq.answer: The VKU is a two-day course that bridges the gap between theory and practical driving lessons to increase traffic safety. It focuses on developing traffic sense and driving school didactics.

faq.question: When must I attend the VKU?
faq.answer: The VKU is mandatory for everyone obtaining a category B (car) or category A1/A (motorcycle) license for the first time. A valid learner's permit is required for registration.

faq.question: How long does the VKU take?
faq.answer: The VKU lasts 8 hours, at DriveLab intensively over two days.

faq.question: How much does a VKU cost?
faq.answer: The VKU in Zug costs CHF 230.-. This includes all costs such as learning materials, certificate, drinks, and fruit.

faq.question: How long is the traffic theory valid?
faq.answer: Forever. A completed VKU remains valid indefinitely.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to the VKU?
faq.answer: Just your mobile phone, as some content is available online. Learning materials, drinks, fruit, writing instruments, and note material are provided and included in the price.
